intro: Byrsonima bicorniculata, commonly known as the two-horned balsa, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive two-horned calyx at the base of its flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in terminal panicles. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
